org.jvnet.hk2.component
Interface InhabitantHandle<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
InhabitantHandleImpl
public interface InhabitantHandle<T>

This is the handle returned by the InhabitantHandler when a service is registered.

If you need to unregister a service, you will need to use this handle to do so.

A test-only, helper construct.

Author:
Jeff Trent

isCommitted

boolean isCommitted()
Checks whether this handle has been committed to the habitat

Returns:
true if this handle has been committed

commit

void commit()
Commits the inhabitant to the habitat (along with all of its related indexes). Once commit is called, the this handle is no longer modifiable

release

void release()
Unregisters the inhabitant from the habitat (along with all of its related indexes). Once release is called, this handle is modifiable
